data.title: my latest work on D2K
make crates not show up within certain distance of start location
data.body:
There is a problem where the AI is unable to deploy its construction yard if a crate starts right next to it. 

Also, to make things a bit fairer, it would be nice if at the beginning of the game, crates didn't start out next to your starting location, and they were farther away from your base.

There should be an option to specify the minimum distance a crate  can be from your start location at the beginning of the game. (And maybe a time limit for when this minimum range expires, say ~60 seconds default).

data.title: make AI not give itself low power
data.body: When the AI builds new buildings, it sometimes puts itself into low power mode, and then has to recover from it. It should build the necessary power output first, and then build the next desired building.

data.title: Attempt to unify versioning with downstream
data.body:
This an attempt to unify versioning between:
- http://software.opensuse.org/package/openra
- http://gentoo-portage.com/games-strategy/openra
- http://archlinux.org/packages/community/any/openra/
- http://openra.ipdx.ru/deb/
- http://www.playdeb.net/software/OpenRA
- and http://openra.res0l.net/download/

to make it more comfortable to package OpenRA for various Linux distributions as well as to join @xaionaro's auto-update development servers who require `Version: bleed-$HASH` to be set.

data.title: RA balance
data.body: This turns ttnk and ctnk into awesome (but relatively expensive) late-game units. It also increases the mechanic's damage repair value a little bit, increases mammoth tank turret turn rate and increases medium tank bullet damage.

data.title: updated two maps, dune_boogie & dead_in_motion rdx
Ripped the Dune 2000 assets completely and added some polishing
data.body: This fixes #2341, #2348 and #2521.

data.title: fix artillery explode
data.body:
For some reason artillery wasn't exploding. I had set it at 75% odds last time I edited it. Just making it explode again.
It really needs to explode. It only costs $600 and is pretty powerful. This is its drawback, to make it vulnerable if player bunches them up.

data.title: Update ViewportScrollControllerWidget.cs
data.body: Moved Scroll() out of the if statement checking to see if edge scrolling was enabled thereby fixing bug introduced that stops keyboard from working if edge scrolling is not enabled.

data.title: Fixed attack dog voice
d2k: cleaning up weapons & pre-requisites
cleaning up custom prerequisites
Able to see enemy AI production bars
data.body: Tested on bleed and happens in both RA/Cnc. Haven't tried with actual players yet.

data.title: Repairable bridges
data.body:
Putting this up for review now, but I plan on doing the rules for RA before merging.

Engineers get a repair cursor over the ends of a dead bridge, and you can force-attack to repair damaged bridges (to avoid conflict with the move order). Undamaged bridges will give a repair-blocked cursor.

Long bridges will grow from the repaired end at ~2 spans / second, and destroy any ships in its path.

data.title: allow tooltip for enemy buildings under fog
data.body: When a building is under fog, your cursor will not give you a tool tip when doing a mouseover of the building. It should tell you what building it is and who owns it.

data.title: add time delay for certain units in a crate
data.body:
It's fun to have powerful units show up in a crate (e.g. mammoth tank, mcv, etc.) but if they show up too early, they can wreck the game balance. They should not show up at the beginning of the game, ideally. To allow powerful units to show up in crates--without upsetting the balance--there should be a time delay feature for crates.
It could work like this:

```
    GiveMcvCrateAction@:
        SelectionShares: 5
                         TimeDelay: 600
        NoBaseSelectionShares: 9001
        Unit: mcv
```

This would make it so that the MCV unit can only show up after 10 minutes of gameplay (600 s). This allows us to include a powerful unit in a crate--and even to give it good odds--but without risking throwing the game completely off at the beginning.

In CNC, mcv crates are currently disabled but I would love to re-enable them. 
D2K would also benefit from this time delay functionality.

data.title: fix enemies showing on minimap under fog
Playtest 20130412 - on Windows: Deselecting Edge Scroll Lose Ability to Use Arrow Scroll Too
data.body:
In this playtest on Windows, when I deselect the option "Enable Edge Scrolling" the game disallows scrolling at all... even using the arrows. Generally, I disable edge scrolling and just use arrows, as edge scrolling bugs me. This doesn't work anymore because I am unable to scroll at all when deselected, even with arrows or dragging or any other means.

![Capture](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/1093721/376160/394d5d18-a408-11e2-865c-fdfdba48bbfb.JPG)

data.title: making FIX cheaper, since no one uses it. Lower HP
data.body:
Nobody uses repair bay, because it's not a pre-requisite for anything, and it's expensive. Reducing cost from $1200 to $600.
To compensate for its lower value, its HP are being lowered as well, from 800 to 400. Now it should be killable with an airstrike, which is about right. 

To anyone paying attention: there has been some discussion over whether repairs should be cheaper. I am agnostic on the issue for now. How about we see if people like the repair bay more now and consider using it, before making further balance changes? Open to discussion.
